channel.title: [VPS] Ram out of memory?
channel.description:
Ok so im using vpsland as a vps hoster heres the info on the vps.
So far i'v tryed playing with the XM (JVM argument) Varibles and I have only decressed the number witch im pretty sure is what your suppose to do but it went from. 800:512:256, Havent changed sence then cuase it just kept crashing, I had a VPS befor and it never had this problem I have JRE6 installed and JDK 25 using classpath and path environments to go to JDK25, Suggest [b]ANY[/b] thing you might know. Oh and I also reinstalled java and have x86. (64bit VPS) [code]512mb RAM Remote desktop connection: 2 Disk space: 10GB Bandwidth/mo.: 250GB Dedicated IP Adress 1 Firewall/intrusion Proection: Enabled Customer controlled backups/restores: Enabled[/code]
And here would be my error:
[code]# # There is insufficient memory for the Java Runtime Environment to continue. # Native memory allocation (malloc) failed to allocate 4092 bytes for char in c:\build_area\jdk6_25\hotspot\src\share\vm\utilities/stack.inline.hpp # Possible reasons: # The system is out of physical RAM or swap space # In 32 bit mode, the process size limit was hit # Possible solutions: # Reduce memory load on the system # Increase physical memory or swap space # Check if swap backing store is full # Use 64 bit Java on a 64 bit OS # Decrease Java heap size (-Xmx/-Xms) # Decrease number of Java threads # Decrease Java thread stack sizes (-Xss) # Set larger code cache with -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize= # This output file may be truncated or incomplete. # # Out of Memory Error (memory/allocation.inline.hpp:44), pid=9292, tid=17516 # # JRE version: 6.0_25-b06 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (20.0-b11 mixed mode, sharing windows-x86 )

item.title: [VPS] Ram out of memory?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

By the looks of it your VPS has 512mb of RAM and you’re trying to allocate 4092mb of RAM, I suggest you change the 4092 to 512 in your run.bat

Read full topic

item.title: [VPS] Ram out of memory?
item.dc:creator: @Shadowspkin Shadowspkin
item.description:
@Shadowspkin wrote:

Ok so im using vpsland as a vps hoster heres the info on the vps.

So far i’v tryed playing with the XM (JVM argument) Varibles and I have only decressed the number witch im pretty sure is what your suppose to do but it went from. 800:512:256, Havent changed sence then cuase it just kept crashing, I had a VPS befor and it never had this problem I have JRE6 installed and JDK 25 using classpath and path environments to go to JDK25, Suggest ANY thing you might know. Oh and I also reinstalled java and have x86. (64bit VPS)

512mb RAM Remote desktop connection: 2 Disk space: 10GB Bandwidth/mo.: 250GB Dedicated IP Adress 1 Firewall/intrusion Proection: Enabled Customer controlled backups/restores: Enabled

And here would be my error:

[code]#

There is insufficient memory for the Java Runtime Environment to continue.

Native memory allocation (malloc) failed to allocate 4092 bytes for char in c:\build_area\jdk6_25\hotspot\src\share\vm\utilities/stack.inline.hpp

Possible reasons:

The system is out of physical RAM or swap space

In 32 bit mode, the process size limit was hit

Possible solutions:

Reduce memory load on the system

Increase physical memory or swap space

Check if swap backing store is full

Use 64 bit Java on a 64 bit OS

Decrease Java heap size (-Xmx/-Xms)

Decrease number of Java threads

Decrease Java thread stack sizes (-Xss)

Set larger code cache with -XX:ReservedCodeCacheSize=
